attributes.action: Establish & support a queer (LGBT+) community centre in London.
attributes.additional_details: London's LGBT community currently centres around Soho and Vauxhall's bars and clubs, normalising and promoting drug use (I.e. alcohol) in LGBT youth. This MUST change for the wellbeing of society as whole so that we are empowered to confront issues facing our community.
attributes.background: London's LGBT community is diverse and long established, yet no queer spaces exist apart from commercial venues. The community is experiencing an array of issues that we need a community centre to help us build peer support and contribute to the society we are a part of. We need a safe place.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is an issue that you might want to raise with the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions
